javadoc: HelpService defines a service for displaying Help content by an ID or URL.

methods.name: showHelp
methods.comment: Display the Help content identified by the help object.

params.name: helpObject
params.comment: the object to which help was previously registered

params.name: infoOnly
params.comment: display HelpLocation information only, not the help UI

methods.name: showHelp
methods.comment:
Display the help page for the given URL.  This is a specialty method for displaying
 help when a specific file is desired, like an introduction page.  Showing help for 
 objects within the system is accomplished by calling 
 #showHelp(Object, boolean, Component).

methods.name: excludeFromHelp
methods.comment:
Signals to the help system to ignore the given object when searching for and validating 
 help.  Once this method has been called, no help can be registered for the given object.

params.name: helpObject
params.comment: the object to exclude from the help system.

methods.name: isExcludedFromHelp
methods.comment: Returns true if the given object is meant to be ignored by the help system

methods.name: registerHelp
methods.comment:
Register help for a specific object.  
 
 Do not call this method will a null help location.  Instead, to signal that
 an item has no help, call #excludeFromHelp(Object).

params.name: helpObject
params.comment: the object to associate the specified help location with

methods.javadoc:
Removes this object from the help system.  This method is useful, for example, 
 when a single Java {@link Component} will have different help locations 
 assigned over its lifecycle.
@param helpObject the object for which to clear help
methods.name: clearHelp
methods.comment:
Removes this object from the help system.  This method is useful, for example, 
 when a single Java Component will have different help locations 
 assigned over its lifecycle.

params.name: helpObject
params.comment: the object for which to clear help

methods.name: getHelpLocation
methods.comment:
Returns the registered (via #registerHelp(Object, HelpLocation) help 
 location for the given object; null if there is no registered
 help.

params.name: object
params.comment: The object for which to find a registered HelpLocation.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the help system has been initialized properly; false if help does not
 exist or is not working.
@return true if the help system has found the applications help content and has finished
         initializing
methods.name: helpExists
methods.comment:
Returns true if the help system has been initialized properly; false if help does not
 exist or is not working.

return.comment:
true if the help system has found the applications help content and has finished
         initializing

name: HelpService
comment:
HelpService defines a service for displaying Help content by
 an ID or URL.
